channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Ex-Syrian commander claims missing US journalist Austin Tice was executed
item.description: Major General Bassam Al Hassan claims former Syrian President Assad ordered Austin Tice's execution.

item.title: 'Nowhere feels safe': Iranians on life under Israeli attacks
item.description: Some of those in Iran who have spoken to the BBC use one word to describe life in there right now.

item.title: 'It's heavy on the heart': Israelis survey damage in city hit by Iranian missile
item.description: Two people were killed and several homes destroyed when a missile hit the city of Rishon LeZion early on Saturday.

item.title: Israel-Iran strikes: What are the worst-case scenarios?
item.description: The BBC's James Landale looks at what could happen if the fighting escalates and expands.

item.title: Israel's endgame may be regime change in Iran - but it's a gamble
item.description: Israeli leaders might hope Friday's strikes start a chain reaction leading to unrest that topples the Islamic Republic, writes Amir Azimi.

item.title: Fifteen killed by Israeli fire near Gaza aid site, hospitals say
item.description: Information on the latest incident is scarce as the internet has been down in Gaza for more than two days.

item.title: In Iran, grief for civilian casualties but little pity for commanders
item.description: Many Iranians criticise their leaders for failing to protect the country - but others insist on its right to a nuclear programme.

item.title: What satellite imagery and verified video tell us about the Israeli strikes on Iran
item.description: Israel's wave of strikes against Iran, which began on Thursday night, has continued through today. BBC Verify's Merlyn Thomas has been examining footage of the attacks and the damage they've caused.

item.title: Who were the Iranian commanders killed in Israel's attack?
item.description: Among the military figures killed is Mohammad Bagheri, the highest-ranking officer in Iran.

item.title: What we know as Israel-Iran conflict intensifies
item.description: The fighting began when Israel struck nuclear targets in Iran on Friday, in what Tehran called a 'declaration of war'.

item.title: CIA analyst who leaked Israel strike plan sentenced to three years
item.description: Asif William Rahman used top security clearance to print and circulate documents over several months.

item.title: Six Gaza aid boat activists deported from Israel after three days in detention
item.description: Their boat was intercepted on Monday as they attempted to break Israel's naval blockade on Gaza and deliver a symbolic amount of aid.

item.title: 'They're weak': Israelis back conflict with Iran in neighbourhood struck by missile
item.description: Bat Yam, just south of Tel Aviv, has long been a stronghold of support for Israel's right-wing governing coalition.

item.title: Iran is reeling from Israel's unprecedented attack - and it is only the start
item.description: Israel's Operation Rising Lion is more extensive and ambitious than anything that has come before, says Frank Gardner

item.title: A frail cry and relief: Malnourished baby Siwar evacuated from Gaza
item.description: The BBC travels in an ambulance from the Gaza border to Amman with Siwar and her family

item.title: Hamas faces leadership vacuum at critical time with demise of Gaza 'War Council'
item.description: The killing of Mohammed Sinwar marks the end of the secretive group that planned the 7 October 2023 attack on Israel.

item.title: Syria former prison guard – 'I showed them no mercy'
item.description: The BBC heard from dozens of former officials about their role enforcing the brutality of the Assad regime.

item.title: Bowen: Israel is accused of the gravest war crimes - how governments respond could haunt them for years
item.description: Distinguished lawyers, senior humanitarians and diplomats tell Jeremy Bowen why they are increasingly concerned about the catastrophe inside Gaza.

item.title: 'I begged for help, but only God answered': Growing dangers of pregnancy and childbirth in Gaza
item.description: Rather than representing the hope of new life, babies in Gaza have come to epitomise the struggle to survive.

item.title: The Today Debate: Israel-Gaza - are we witnessing war crimes?
item.description: The BBC’s Anna Foster hosts a debate to discuss whether there have been war crimes in Israel and Gaza.

item.title: Hopes of parenthood crushed after IVF embryos destroyed in Israel's Gaza offensive
item.description: Couples in Gaza using IVF to help them conceive “left with nothing” after 4,000 embryos at an IVF clinic were destroyed.

item.title: 'Situation is dire' - BBC returns to Gaza baby left hungry by Israeli blockade
item.description: Malnourished five-month-old baby Siwar is now out of hospital in Gaza - but as we found, she and her family are struggling.

item.title: Chaos spreads as desperate Gazans wait for food to arrive
item.description: Lawlessness is stopping food from reaching people, while a clash at an aid convoy on Thursday night turned deadly.

item.title: Watch: Explosions and damage across Israel as Iran launches fresh air strikes
item.description: Five people have been killed and dozens injured, according to Israel's national emergency service.

item.title: Footage captures exchange of attacks between Iran and Israel
item.description: Israel and Iran have continued to attack each other throughout the night

item.title: 'Destruction all around': BBC reports from Israeli city targeted by Iran
item.description: Israeli authorities have indicated that this could be the beginning of a prolonged campaign against Iran.

item.title: 'A very long night of attacks, with fears of more to come'
item.description: The BBC's Hugo Bachega reports from Jerusalem as the two sides trade fire.

item.title: Watch: Israel strikes targets across Iran as leaders vow to fight
item.description: Israel's prime minister said Iran's nuclear capability posed a "clear and present danger", while Iran's president promised a "powerful" response.

item.title: Watch: Footage shows explosions and buildings ablaze in Iran
item.description: Israel says it has carried out strikes on Iran's nuclear programme, with blasts and fires seen in Tehran and elsewhere.

item.title: Analysis: Why has Israel chosen to attack Iran now?
item.description: The BBC's Hugo Bachega reports from Jerusalem, after Israel launched overnight strikes against sites across Iran.

item.title: Video shows crowds in Gaza scale fence to rush for aid
item.description: Palestinians can be seen climbing over fences and running to get humanitarian aid in the footage.
